ref-list.div: Papers of particular interest, published recently, have been highlighted as: • Of importance •• Of major importance

ref.div: •• AMAP (2017) Snow, water, ice and permafrost in the Arctic (SWIPA) 2017. Arctic Monitoring and Assessment Programme (AMAP), XIV:269. Comprehensive overview of recent and expected changes of the Arctic hydro- and cryosphere.

element-citation.div: BedMachine v3: Complete bed topography and ocean bathymetry mapping of Greenland from multibeam echo sounding combined with mass conservation
Geophys Res Lett

ref.div: Overland JE, Hanna E, Hanssen-Bauer I, Kim SJ, Walsh J, Wang M, Bhatt US, Thoman RL (2016) Surface air temperature [in Artic Report Card 2016], http://www.arctic.noaa.gov/Report-Card.

•• IPCC, 2013. Climate change 2013: the physical science basis. Contribution of Working Group I to the Fifth Assessment Report of the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change. In: Stocker TF, Qin D, Plattner G-K, Tignor M, Allen SK, Boschung J, Nauels A, Xia Y, Bex V, Midgley PM, editors. . Cambridge, UK and New York, NY, USA: Cambridge University Press. p. 1535. 10.1017/CBO9781107415324. This synthesis report is a key reference for understanding the state of climate change science and projections for future change.
